title: How to Make a Ribbon Flower Brooch

steps.headline: Make a flower.
Make two bows.
Stick the brooch.

text:
Make a flower. Cut out a long strip of pink polyester ribbon and running stitch along one side of ribbon, and then pull the thread tightly to gather the ribbon as the picture shows. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0f/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0f/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-1Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Knot and cut excess thread when you finish. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c0/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c0/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-1Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-1Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Roll one end of ruffled ribbon from inwards until to make a full flower shape. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-1Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-1Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cb/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-1Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-1Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Make two bows. Glue the end of the ribbon in place. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/58/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/58/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-2Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-2Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Cut out a strip of organza ribbon and wrap a circle around the bottom of the flower; glue the ends. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/aa/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/aa/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-2Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-2Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Fold two bows with two strips of green polyester ribbon and secure with glue. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-2Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-2Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Stick the brooch. Make a loop with a dot ribbon and glue the middle to the green bows at an angle. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-3Bullet1.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-3Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Stick the flower to the middle of the bows. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0f/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0f/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-3Bullet2.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-3Bullet2.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"} Attach the brooch to the back side of the bows with a round felt between them for securing. {"smallUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-460px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","bigUrl":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-3Bullet3.jpg/v4-760px-Make-a-Ribbon-Flower-Brooch-Step-3Bullet3.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons


"}
